abstract: Study conducted by Stanford Medical School student Nathan Lo finds that $1.3 billion America has spent since 2005 to stop HIV infection in Africa through abstinence and fidelity was largely wasted.
lead_paragraph: The government’s $1.3 billion program to stop H.I.V. infection in Africa is not cost effective, a new study by a Stanford student shows.

headline.main: U.S. Push for Abstinence in Africa Is Seen as Failure Against H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: American H.I.V. Battle in Africa Is Said to Falter

snippet: The government’s $1.3 billion program to stop H.I.V. infection in Africa is not cost effective, a new study by a Stanford student shows.
